com.stepstone.stepper

Class StepperLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.LinearLayout
          • com.stepstone.stepper.StepperLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, TabsContainer.TabItemListener

    public class StepperLayout
extends android.widget.LinearLayout
implements TabsContainer.TabItemListener
    Stepper widget implemented according to the Material documentation.
    It allows for setting three types of steppers:
    - mobile dots stepper,
    - mobile progress bar stepper,
    - horizontal stepper with tabs.
    Include this stepper in the layout XML file and choose a stepper type with ms_stepperType.
    Check out values/attrs.xml - StepperLayout for a complete list of customisable properties.

      • onTabClicked

        @UiThread
public void onTabClicked(int position)
        Description copied from interface: TabsContainer.TabItemListener
        Called when a tab gets clicked
        Specified by:
        onTabClicked in interface TabsContainer.TabItemListener
        Parameters:
        position - position of the tab/step

      • proceed

        public void proceed()
        This is an equivalent of clicking the Next/Complete button from the bottom navigation. Unlike setCurrentStepPosition(int) this actually verifies the step.

      • onBackClicked

        public void onBackClicked()
        To be called when the user wants to go to the previous step.

      • setCurrentStepPosition

        public void setCurrentStepPosition(int currentStepPosition)
        Sets the current step to the one at the provided index. This does not verify the current step.
        Parameters:
        currentStepPosition - new current step position

      • getCurrentStepPosition

        public int getCurrentStepPosition()
        Returns the position of the currently selected step.
        Returns:
        position of the currently selected step

      • setNextButtonVerificationFailed

        public void setNextButtonVerificationFailed(boolean verificationFailed)
        Sets whether the Next button in the bottom navigation bar should be in the 'verification failed' state i.e. still clickable but with an option to display it differently to indicate to the user that he cannot go to the next step yet.
        Parameters:
        verificationFailed - false if verification failed, true otherwise

      • setCompleteButtonVerificationFailed

        public void setCompleteButtonVerificationFailed(boolean verificationFailed)
        Sets whether the Complete button in the bottom navigation bar should be in the 'verification failed' state i.e. still clickable but with an option to display it differently to indicate to the user that he cannot finish the process yet.
        Parameters:
        verificationFailed - false if verification failed, true otherwise

      • setNextButtonEnabled

        public void setNextButtonEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether the Next button in the bottom navigation bar should be enabled (clickable). setting this to false will make it unclickable.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the button should be clickable, false otherwise

      • setCompleteButtonEnabled

        public void setCompleteButtonEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether the Complete button in the bottom navigation bar should be enabled (clickable). setting this to false will make it unclickable.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the button should be clickable, false otherwise

      • setBackButtonEnabled

        public void setBackButtonEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether the Back button in the bottom navigation bar should be enabled (clickable). setting this to false will make it unclickable.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the button should be clickable, false otherwise

      • setShowBottomNavigation

        public void setShowBottomNavigation(boolean showBottomNavigation)
        Set whether the bottom navigation bar (with Back/Next/Complete buttons) should be visible. true by default.
        Parameters:
        showBottomNavigation - true if bottom navigation should be visible, false otherwise

      • updateErrorState

        public void updateErrorState(@Nullable
                             VerificationError error)
        Updates the error state in the UI. It does nothing if showing error state is disabled. This is used internally to show the error on tabs.
        Parameters:
        error - not null if error should be shown, null otherwise
        See Also:
        setShowErrorStateEnabled(boolean)

      • setOffscreenPageLimit

        public void setOffscreenPageLimit(int limit)
        Set the number of steps that should be retained to either side of the current step in the view hierarchy in an idle state. Steps beyond this limit will be recreated from the adapter when needed.
        Parameters:
        limit - How many steps will be kept offscreen in an idle state.
        See Also:
        ViewPager.setOffscreenPageLimit(int)

      • showProgress

        public void showProgress(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String progressMessage)
        Shows a progress indicator if not already shown. This does not have to be a progress bar and it depends on chosen stepper feedback types.
        Parameters:
        progressMessage - optional progress message if supported by the selected types

      • hideProgress

        public void hideProgress()
        Hides the progress indicator if visible.

      • isInProgress

        public boolean isInProgress()
        Checks if there's an ongoing operation i.e. if showProgress(String) was called and not followed by hideProgress() yet.
        Returns:
        true if in progress, false otherwise

      • setFeedbackType

        public void setFeedbackType(int feedbackTypeMask)
        Sets the mask for the stepper feedback type.
        Parameters:
        feedbackTypeMask - step feedback type mask, should contain one or more flags from StepperFeedbackType

      • getContentFadeAlpha

        public float getContentFadeAlpha()
        Returns:
        An alpha value from 0 to 1.0f to be used for the faded out view if 'content_fade' stepper feedback is set. 0.5f by default.

      • getContentOverlayBackground

        @DrawableRes
public int getContentOverlayBackground()
        Returns:
        Background res ID to be used for the overlay on top of the content if 'content_overlay' stepper feedback type is set. 0 if default background should be used.
